summary: This is a USMS prisoner schedule report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9, 2019. It lists numerous inmates, their scheduled court productions, and associated security cautions. The document is a routine administrative log and does not directly mention Jeffrey Epstein or his case.

events.title: MCC New York Prisoner Court Productions
events.description: Routine schedule of inmate movements from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York to various court proceedings, including transfers, status hearings, sentencings, and plea changes.

locations.description: Location of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, the facility from which the prisoners are being scheduled for transport.

keyFacts: This document is a routine USMS prisoner schedule report for MCC New York dated August 9, 2019, detailing inmate movements for court appearances.
The document lists over 40 inmates, none of whom are Jeffrey Epstein or known associates from his case, indicating this is general prison administration.
Multiple inmates have 'Separatee Warnings' and specific security cautions, indicating they must be kept apart from certain other individuals.
One inmate, Samuel Ceruti, has extensive NYCDOC restrictions noted, including no phone calls except to a lawyer, 23-hour lockdown, gang affiliation, and a charge of witness tampering.
The document's significance to the Epstein case is minimal; it appears to be a standard administrative record from the federal detention system.
